@description.name: @description
@description.body:
AbstractRequest serves as a base class for {@link qx.io.request.Xhr}
and {@link qx.io.request.Jsonp}. It contains methods to conveniently
communicate with transports found in {@link qx.bom.request}.

The general procedure to derive a new request is to choose a
transport (override {@link #_createTransport}) and link
the transport’s response (override {@link #_getParsedResponse}).
The transport must implement {@link qx.bom.request.IRequest}.

To adjust the behavior of {@link #send} override
{@link #_getConfiguredUrl} and {@link #_getConfiguredRequestHeaders}.

NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String?} The URL of the resource to request.
@param.description: The URL of the resource to request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on every change of the transport’s readyState.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when request completes without error and transport’s status
indicates success.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request completes without error.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request completes with or without error.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request is aborted.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request reaches timeout limit.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request completes with error.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request completes without error but erroneous HTTP status.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the configured parser runs into an unrecoverable error.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired on timeout, error or remote error.

This event is fired for convenience. Usually, it is recommended
to handle error related events in a more fine-grained approach.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired on change of the parsed response. This event allows to use data binding with the parsed response as source. For example, to bind the response to the value of a label: 
// req is an instance of qx.io.request.*,
// label an instance of qx.ui.basic.Label
req.bind("response", label, "value");
The response is parsed (and therefore changed) only after the request completes successfully. This means that when a new request is made the initial empty value is ignored, instead only the final value is bound.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on change of the phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The URL of the resource to request.

Note: Depending on the configuration of the request
and/or the transport chosen, query params may be appended
automatically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Timeout limit in milliseconds. Default (0) means no limit.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Data to be sent as part of the request.

Supported types:

* String
* Map
* qooxdoo Object
* Blob
* ArrayBuffer
* FormData

For maps, Arrays and qooxdoo objects, a URL encoded string
with unsafe characters escaped is internally generated and sent
as part of the request.

Depending on the underlying transport and its configuration, the request
data is transparently included as URL query parameters or embedded in the
request body as form data.

If a string is given the user must make sure it is properly formatted and
escaped. See {@link qx.util.Serializer#toUriParameter}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Authentication delegate.

The delegate must implement {@link qx.io.request.authentication.IAuthentication}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Bound handlers.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Parsed response.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Abort flag.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Current phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Request headers.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Request headers (deprecated).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Holds transport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Holds information about the parser status for the last request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create and return transport.

This method MUST be overridden, unless the constructor is overridden as
well. It is called by the constructor and should return the transport that
is to be interfaced.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get configured URL.

A configured URL typically includes a query string that
encapsulates transport specific settings such as request
data or no-cache settings.

This method MAY be overridden. It is called in {@link #send}
before the request is initialized.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get configuration related request headers.

This method MAY be overridden to add request headers for features limited
to a certain transport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get parsed response.

Is called in the {@link #_onReadyStateChange} event handler
to parse and store the transport’s response.

This method MUST be overridden.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The parsed response of the request.
@return.description: The parsed response of the request.

@description.name: @description
@description
@description
@description.body: Send request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Abort request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Apply configured request headers to transport.

This method MAY be overridden to customize application of request headers
to transport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get all request headers.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Retrieve authentication headers from auth delegate.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Set a request header.

Note: Setting request headers has no effect after the request was send.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a request header.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Remove a request header.

Note: Removing request headers has no effect after the request was send.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get low-level transport. Note: To be used with caution! This method can be used to query the transport directly, but should be used with caution. Especially, it is not advisable to call any destructive methods such as open or send.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method mainly exists so that some methods found in the

@description.name: @description
@description.body: low-level transport can be deliberately omitted here,

@description.name: @description
@description.body: but still be accessed should it be absolutely necessary.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Valid use cases include to query the transport’s responseXML

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property if performance is critical and any extra parsing

@description.name: @description
@description.body: should be avoided at all costs.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} An instance of a class found in qx.bom.request.*
@return.description: An instance of a class found in qx.bom.request.*

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get current ready state.

States can be:
UNSENT:           0,
OPENED:           1,
HEADERS_RECEIVED: 2,
LOADING:          3,
DONE:             4

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get current phase. A more elaborate version of {@link #getReadyState}, this method indicates the current phase of the request. Maps to stateful (i.e. deterministic) events (success, abort, timeout, statusError) and intermediate readyStates (unsent, configured, loading, load). When the requests is successful, it progresses the states:
'unsent', 'opened', 'sent', 'loading', 'load', 'success' In case of failure, the final state is one of:
'abort', 'timeout', 'statusError' For each change of the phase, a {@link #changePhase} data event is fired.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get status code.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get status text.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get raw (unprocessed) response.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The raw response of the request.
@return.description: The raw response of the request.

@description.body: Get all response headers from response.

@description.body: Resets the user value of the property url. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability.
